page.title: 01Mid Stort Valley
page.content: This is a rural area with four arteries crossing north to south, ie. A1184 trunk road, M11 Motorway, Stort Navigation and railway into London. The area is agricultural but few inhabitants work on the land. Some travel to nearby towns such as Harlow or bishop's Stortford and others commute into London or its suburbs. There are some small industrial units with workshops. the canalised river is used soley for leisure purposes. there is a marina and retaurants near Tednambury. Little Hallingbury and Spellbrook are comparatively new residential areas. There are several unspoilt villages such as Howe Green, Motts Green, Gaston Green and Woodside green. Public transport is not good in spite of several bus routes through the area. Such services are mainly at rush hours or market day services to
